case_summary: This dispute centred on the interpretation of a sublease agreement entered into between two companies in the food and beverage industry. The appellant (“YES”) operated out of Unit #02-137/138 (“Unit 137”) while the respondent (“Soup”) operated out of the neighbouring Unit #02-141 (“Unit 141”). The issue arose as to the duration for which the sublease agreement remained valid and subsisting.
corem: ['Sundaresh Menon CJ', 'Chao Hick Tin JA', 'Andrew Phang Boon Leong JA']

case_summary: Public Prosecutor v Vijayakumar s/o Veeriah [2005] SGHC 221 is a criminal law case in which the accused was charged with murder of a close friend. The court had to consider whether the right of private defence and the exceptions of exceeding private defence and sudden fight applied to reduce the charge from murder to culpable homicide.

This case covers the areas of Patents and Inventions, specifically Infringement, Subject Matter and Validity. Trek Technology (Singapore) Pte Ltd and another appealed the decision to allow amendments to their patent, claiming infringement by FE Global Electronics Pte Ltd and others, who had sold storage devices similar to Trek's Thumbdrive device. The court had to decide if the amendments were appropriate and if the combination of prior art amounted to an inventive step.
corem: ['Yong Pung How CJ', 'Chao Hick Tin JA', 'Tan Lee Meng J']

case_summary: Lee Tat Cheng v Maka GPS Technologies Pte Ltd [2018] SGCA 18 was a case heard in the Court of Appeal regarding whether the proprietor's act of sending cease-and-desist letters amounted to groundless threats and whether the alleged infringer, offering for sale models of in-vehicle cameras, infringed the product claim in the patent. The case also considered whether the UK Supreme Court's decision in Actavis UK Ltd v Eli Lilly and Co [2017] UKSC 48 ought to be applied in Singapore.
corem: ['Sundaresh Menon CJ', 'Andrew Phang Boon Leong JA', 'Judith Prakash JA']

case_summary: Lim Oon Kuin and others v Rajah & Tann Singapore LLP and another appeal is a case that covers civil procedure, breach of confidence and the legal profession. It involves the power of joinder in regards to a third party seeking to be added to an action, and whether the respondent law firm should be restrained from acting for a company on the basis of breach of confidence and the supervisory jurisdiction of the court.
corem: ['Sundaresh Menon CJ', 'Andrew Phang Boon Leong JCA', 'Judith Prakash JCA', 'Belinda Ang Saw Ean JAD', 'Chao Hick Tin SJ']
